alert.note: Alert for Hawaii in Hawaii (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 30 at 1:46AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 AM HST EARLY THIS MORNING FOR THE ISLAND OF HAWAII IN HAWAII COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...The island of Hawaii in Hawaii County. * WHEN...Until 445 AM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 134 AM HST, radar shows a persistent band of moderate to heavy showers streaming northward over the Big Island. Rainfall rates of 1 to 2 inches are occurring, with the peak totals measured over the southeast slopes of the Kau and Puna Districts and over portions of the South Hilo District within the past few hours. Similar showers have started developing and moving ashore along the leeward coast south of Kailua- Kona. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hilo, Kailua-Kona, Hawaiian Paradise Park, Captain Cook, Wood Valley, Volcano, Pohakuloa Training Area, Hawaii Volcanoes National Park, Pahala, Pohakuloa Camp, Glenwood, Punaluu Beach, Kawa Flats, Mountain View, Honaunau, Kealakekua, Naalehu, Kainaliu and Honalo. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 445 AM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, drainage ditches and low lying areas prone to flooding.
